revised_title: Art Discoveries in the Subterranean City of Herculaneum
tldr: The author examines the paintings found in the subterranean city of Herculaneum, focusing on their styles, techniques, and historical significance. The paintings, done in watercolors on stucco, are found in various locations such as amphitheaters, temples, and houses. The author discusses the unique characteristics of these paintings, their preservation, and their importance to the understanding of ancient Roman art.
